article_text:
Ways to save

Here are a few ways to lower drug costs if you don’t have insurance:

1. New York state’s Department of Health website allows consumers t...

article_metadata.description:
The Affordable Care Act has put health insurance within reach of most New Yorkers. But for those still without it, buying prescription medication can be a bewildering and expensive headache.
That was Daryl Warmbrand’s experience when he went shopping for an antibiotic.
The 53-year-old Chester resident does not have health insurance. He makes too much money to qualify for a subsidy under the ACA, but is not wealthy enough to afford the premium and the out-of-pocket expenses on his own.
So
article_metadata.author: Hema Easley Times Herald-Record
